result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Richmond, Marsai M
defendant.address: 410 Van Dyke St, Saint Paul, MN 55119

records.addlTxt: Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkel (Reserve Branch).  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Davila, Br. 01.

Defendant Marsai M Richmond in court.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Marsai M Richmond.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in Court for plea/sentencing hearing. Case remains in resolution posture. Defense requested adjournment of proceedings. Court grants request.  Case remains calendared in Branch 01.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, and Addendum to Plea, filed.

Defendant Marsai M Richmond in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case is no longer in deferred prosecution resolution.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Reserve Branch 13.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Marsai M Richmond in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marsai M Richmond appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defense informed Court that the defendant has a LSAR scheduled for 6/10/2022 at 8:30 a.m. DPA Hearing scheduled in Branch 37.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Court ordered no possession or use any firearms or no dangerous weapons.

Defendant Marsai M Richmond in court.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Marsai M Richmond
Current: 410 Van Dyke St, Saint Paul, MN 55119 United States  (Effective: 05-19-2022)
Prior: 3600 South 94Th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53228
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/19/2022@2:00p
